channel.title: üè¢ Google Research on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Google Research on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Approximating the Top Eigenvector in Random Order Streams
item.description: Random-order stream data necessitates efficient top eigenvector approximation; this paper presents novel algorithms with improved space complexity, achieving near-optimal bounds.

item.title: Auditing Privacy Mechanisms via Label Inference Attacks
item.description: New metrics audit label privatization, revealing differentially private schemes often outperform heuristic methods in the privacy-utility tradeoff.

item.title: Extending Video Masked Autoencoders to 128 frames
item.description: Long-video masked autoencoders (LVMAE) achieve state-of-the-art performance by using an adaptive masking strategy that prioritizes important video tokens, enabling efficient training on 128 frames.

item.title: Generative Forests
item.description: Generative Forests (GFs) revolutionize tabular data generation with a novel forest-based model and a simple boosting algorithm offering strong convergence guarantees, significantly outperforming curre…

item.title: Learning Generalized Linear Programming Value Functions
item.description: Learn optimal LP values faster with a novel neural network method!

item.title: Linear Regression using Heterogeneous Data Batches
item.description: New algorithm efficiently solves linear regression with heterogeneous data batches, handling diverse input distributions and achieving high accuracy with fewer samples.

item.title: Linear Transformers are Versatile In-Context Learners
item.description: Linear transformers surprisingly learn intricate optimization algorithms, even surpassing baselines on noisy regression problems, showcasing their unexpected learning capabilities.

item.title: The Power of Resets in Online Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Leveraging local simulator resets in online reinforcement learning dramatically improves sample efficiency, especially for high-dimensional problems with general function approximation.

item.title: Who's asking? User personas and the mechanics of latent misalignment
item.description: User personas significantly impact the safety of large language models, bypassing safety filters more effectively than direct prompting methods.
